issue.body:
Hi Team,

**Description:**

Need to configure File Base user store as the primary Usertore and use LDAP(RDBMS) as the secondary user stores. 

Mi version: 4.0.0

Thanks and best regards,
Asitha M

> Describe the problems, issues, or needs driving this feature/fix and include links to related issues in the following format: Resolves issue1, issue2, etc.

## Goals

## Approach
> Describe how you are implementing the solutions. Include an animated GIF or screenshot if the change affects the UI (email documentation@wso2.com to review all UI text). Include a link to a Markdown file or Google doc if the feature write-up is too long to paste here.

## Certification
> Type “Sent” when you have provided new/updated certification questions, plus four answers for each question (correct answer highlighted in bold), based on this change. Certification questions/answers should be sent to certification@wso2.com and NOT pasted in this PR. If there is no impact on certification exams, type “N/A” and explain why.

 - Ran FindSecurityBugs plugin and verified report? yes/no

issue.title: Issue with the Unit testing framework in Integration Studio
issue.body:
**Description:**

In the latest updated Integration Studio 8.2.0, when we try to run unit tests, the synapse unit testing framework try to run tests inside the newly introduced `build-artifacts` module inside the `Configs` project. As a result there will be exception from the unit testing framework and the build will get failed.

As a workaround we can add the `<maven.test.skip>true</maven.test.skip>` property to the `build-artifacts` module.

**Affected Product Version:**
Integration Studio 8.2.0

issue.title: High CPU on JMS error
issue.body:
We observed high CPU usage from WSO2EI when encountering errors with JMS, such as connection slowness or Azure Service Bus timeouts that result in an underlying connection issue. When examining the captured thread dumps, we noticed an unrecoverable IllegalException with the following stack trace.

```
"jms-Worker-17" #219 prio=5 os_prio=0 cpu=150415.42ms elapsed=230.24s tid=0x00007effc80fc000 nid=0x116e9 runnable  [0x00007eff477f4000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.lang.Throwable.fillInStackTrace(java.base@11.0.19/Native Method)
	at java.lang.Throwable.fillInStackTrace(java.base@11.0.19/Throwable.java:787)
	- locked <0x00000000ebf9e9d8> (a javax.jms.IllegalStateException)
	at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(java.base@11.0.19/Throwable.java:270)
	at java.lang.Exception.<init>(java.base@11.0.19/Exception.java:66)
	at javax.jms.JMSException.<init>(JMSException.java:37)
	at javax.jms.IllegalStateException.<init>(IllegalStateException.java:33)
	at javax.jms.IllegalStateException.<init>(IllegalStateException.java:37)
	at org.apache.qpid.jms.JmsMessageConsumer.checkClosed(JmsMessageConsumer.java:395)
	at org.apache.qpid.jms.JmsMessageConsumer.receive(JmsMessageConsumer.java:205)
	at org.apache.axis2.transport.jms.ServiceTaskManager$MessageListenerTask.receiveMessage(ServiceTaskManager.java:668)
	at org.apache.axis2.transport.jms.ServiceTaskManager$MessageListenerTask.run(ServiceTaskManager.java:489)
	at org.apache.axis2.transport.base.threads.NativeWorkerPool$1.run(NativeWorkerPool.java:172)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(java.base@11.0.19/ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1128)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(java.base@11.0.19/ThreadPoolExecutor.java:628)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(java.base@11.0.19/Thread.java:829)
```
While checking the CPU, we noticed that there is a CPU spinning scenario that it seems like this IllegalStateException not handling in the ServiceTaskManager class [1] in the same way which handles the JMS exceptions.

[1] https://github.com/wso2/wso2-axis2-transports/blob/7d6ed28295b2fd6ec009d92a0cf7c68b1e8cbb4e/modules/jms/src/main/java/org/apache/axis2/transport/jms/ServiceTaskManager.java#L718

issue.title: Updating the JDK 11 sub version in the official WSO2 MI docker image.
issue.body: Upgrade the JDK version used in the MI-4.1.0 default docker images to an OpenJDK version equal to or greater than 11.0.20.

issue.title: Local entry is not getting changed after modifying the connection parameters
issue.body: When modifying the connection parameters of a local entry the changes are not getting reflected when the CAR app is re-deployed until the file-connector itself is redeployed or the MI server is restarted.

issue.title: Improve Handling of Common Artifacts Across Multiple CAR Files in WSO2 Integration Studio
issue.body:
## Feature Request:
WSO2 Integration Studio currently generates a multi-maven module project containing integration artifacts. In Choreo, we create a component from this multi-maven module project, which subsequently generates one or more CAR files. A challenge arises when there's a need to share some common artifacts between two or more Integration Studio projects. As of now, the workaround is to duplicate these integration artifacts in each Integration Studio project. However, this approach is not only redundant but also error-prone, especially during maintenance.

We are seeking an improved methodology to efficiently share common artifacts across multiple Integration Studio projects without the need for duplication.

### Potential Benefits:
- Reduced redundancy in integration artifacts across projects.
- Simplified maintenance due to a single source of truth for shared artifacts.
- Enhanced consistency and reliability across Integration Studio projects,

issue.title: Implement Command Line Argument Passing for WSO2 MI in Non-Server Mode
issue.body:
## Feature Request:
We have recently introduced a non-server mode for the WSO2 Micro Integrator (MI), which allows users to run it similar to how one would run a main function in a programming language. However, currently, there's a limitation when starting the MI in this mode – we are unable to pass command-line arguments. This issue is to request the feature to support passing command line arguments when starting the MI in non-server mode.

## Current Behavior:
When starting the WSO2 MI in non-server mode, it does not accept or recognize command line arguments.

## Desired Behavior:
Users should be able to pass command line arguments to the WSO2 MI when running it in non-server mode. These arguments should be accessible and usable within the integrator for various purposes, such as configuration, data processing, etc.

## Potential Benefits:
- Enhanced flexibility for users when running WSO2 MI in non-server mode.
- Ability to dynamically configure or modify the behavior of the automation based on the provided arguments.
- Native support for input argument passing for Manual Tasks with WSO2 MI runtime in Choreo

issue.title: [Improvement] Validate SMB2/SMB3 port in VFS URL
issue.body:
Hi Team,

When using smb2/smb3 with MI, if we provided the port, it will not be considered even if we passed it as as follows,

`smb2://[username]:[password]@[hostname]:[port]/[absolute-path 
`

In the above URI format the [:port] was included as part of the URL. But when the we are trying to use any ports as part of the URL, it seems that to ignored by the MI server.

Also in an ideal scenario, if the we use an invalid port, such as "1234," within the URI, the VFS transport in WSO2 MI 4.2.0 should not function and should generate an error (typically "Invalid URI"). However, MI 4.2.0 does not seem to strictly consider the port validity as long as the remaining components of the URI are correct.

So it would be a good improvement to have the port considered in a future release.
